Bed and Sofa (1927) was directed by Abram Room and remains his most well-known film, a frank portrayal of sexual manners and focused on bringing psychological realism to cinema. 

It tells the story of a mÃƒÂ©nage ÃƒÂ  trois (a very daring plot for Soviet cinema in the 1920s) between one woman (Liuda) and two men (Volodia and Kolia).

*ABOUT THIS SOUNDTRACK:
This inedited soundtrack has been composed entirely with various fragments of music by Dmitri Shostakovich, using mainly his early works, his first Symphony, and some other pieces written for the theatre or for films.
